You can choose to disable personalized voice features and to delete voice recordings. This may degrade your experience using voice features."

send Amazon in-app item purchase notifications
Allows the Amazon Appstore to send purchase notifications to apps, such as when a customer purchases an in-app item o
Within some apps, you can purchase in-app items. Some examples of in-app items include newspaper subscriptions, additional game levels, premium content, or extra functionality.

Appstore collects information on the frequency and duration of use of downloaded apps in order to improve the Appstore experience and the quality of apps we make available. We may also share aggregated or other non-personally identifiable app usage infomration with developers to help them improve their apps.
When parental control is enabled, enter a PIN instead of your Amazon password to purchase in-app items.
When parental control is enabled, your Amazon password or a PIN is required to purchase in-app items.
When notifications are enabled, the Amazon Appstore can notify about important news and completed tasks.
Notify me about the progress and success of downloading or installing apps.
Notify me whenever there are updates available for my apps.

"1.Set the weblab cookie Enter weblab name(s) like this: US_DETAIL_1234:T2&US_SEARCH_123:T1 Alternatively you can leave this blank to clear your cookie value. 2.Clear your session."
Switch between Native and HTML page

"Weinre debug settings explanation: HTML page authors need specify their expected weinre server host and port. They should include http://[weinre host]:[port]/target/target-script-min.js to their page. They can complete this ethier by themselves or by calling the MASH server side api. Note: 1. We will only include the weinre debug info into app context when weinre debug status is on. 2. If the HTML developer doesn't set the weinre host and port, we will include the default weinre debug info into the app context. The default server host is localhost on which the android emulator is running, and the default port is 8080."

"To find an item, enter your search term in the Search box on the Home page or select Search from the device Menu.
To view items within a specific category, select \"All Departments\" at the top of the search results screen and choose a department."

"Once you find an item you wish to buy, you may purchase it by selecting either the Buy Now or Add to Cart button near the bottom of that item's screen. If you are a Prime member with 1–Click ordering turned on, you may select one of the buttons displaying your Prime shipping options to make a 1–Click purchase.
If you are not currently signed in from your mobile device, you will be prompted to enter the e-mail address and password associated with your Amazon.com account in order to complete your purchase.
Please Note: Items placed in your cart will also be visible on the Amazon.com website and vice versa."

"To view items placed in your shopping cart from your mobile device or computer, select Cart from the Home page or device Menu.
To purchase the items in your cart, select the Checkout button at the top or bottom of the Cart screen. To delete, edit quantities, or move items in your cart, highlight the item and select your desired option."

"To view items in any of your Wish Lists, select Wish List from More in the device Menu . If you have more than one Wish List, you may choose which one to view from the top of the Wish List page.
To delete items in your Wish List, highlight the item and select More options.
Please Note: Items placed in your Wish List will also be visible on the Amazon.com website and vice versa."

"1–Click ordering makes buying from Amazon.com on your mobile device fast and easy.
Turning on Mobile 1–Click allows you to skip the shopping cart and the checkout process. You simply select the Buy now with 1–Click button on any product page and have your order automatically charged to the default payment method on your account and shipped to the default address.
To turn Mobile 1–Click on or off from your mobile device, select Your Account from the Home page or device Menu, choose View or Change 1–Click Settings, and follow the instructions. You may also turn off Mobile 1–Click from your computer via Your Account | View or change your 1–Click Settings."

"You can add a new shipping or billing address during the checkout process by manually entering the address or selecting an existing one from your Amazon Address Book.
Please Note: As on the PC site, if you enter a new shipping address during the checkout process, you will be prompted to also provide your card information in order to confirm your identity."

"You can make your gift festive with gift-wrap, a printed gift card, and/or a free gift note to be included on the packing slip.
Gift-wrap prices vary according to the size of the item.
Items designated as gifts that are shipped from Amazon.com to a single U.S. address will not display prices on their packing slips. Other sellers' gift policies may differ.
Please Note: Gift-wrap, printed card, and/or gift note options are not available for all items."

"You may cancel your order for any item sold by Amazon.com, provided that the order has not yet entered the shipping process. To cancel an order immediately after placing it on your mobile device, select Cancel This Order Now on the Thank You page. You may also cancel items or orders placed from your device by selecting Your Account from the device Menu, then View or Cancel Items/Orders.
If the item you want to cancel has already entered the shipping process, it cannot be canceled by you or by our customer service department. However, you can return the item for a refund.
Please Note: We cannot assist you in canceling any orders you have placed from an Amazon Merchant. Instead, please contact the seller directly.
To change billing or shipping information for an order, please visit Your Account on Amazon.com from your computer."

"If you place multiple mobile orders for items sold by Amazon.com within 30 minutes, we will combine the orders into as few shipments as possible to reduce shipping costs.
Please Note: Orders placed through Amazon Marketplace, Amazon Merchants, or other third-party sellers cannot be combined."
To view the status of recent orders, select Your Account from the device menu, then select View/Cancel Items or Orders.
To view the shipping status of recent orders, select Your Account from the device menu, then select Track Packages.
To access Your Account, first sign in from the Sign In area on the Home page. Once you are signed in, select Your Account from the device Menu.

"If you have forgotten your Amazon.com password, select the Forgot Your Password? button on the Sign In page and follow the instructions for entering the e-mail address associated with your Amazon.com account. We'll e-mail you a link to a page where you can create a new password."

"Amazon Prime customers can take advantage of all Prime shipping options when ordering from mobile devices. Prime customers receive free Two-Day Shipping on over 1 million Prime-eligible items and the opportunity to upgrade to One-Day Shipping for as low as $2.99 per item (varies by item size and weight). Prime also offers special weekend and other shipping options for qualifying merchandise, and Free Standard Shipping for eligible items shipped to P.O. boxes in the continental United States (excluding Alaska, Hawaii, and U.S. territories, possessions and protectorates) and APO/FPO addresses with U.S. ZIP codes.
To take full advantage of your Amazon Prime membership, please go to Amazon.com from your computer and ensure that your default shipping method is set to Two-Day.
Not yet a Prime member? Sign up for a new Prime membership by visiting Your Account on Amazon.com from your computer."

This experimental service from Amazon is no longer available via the Amazon Mobile app. If you already have an Amazon Remembers list, you can view it online by visiting https://www.amazon.com/gp/remembers
Do you have comments or suggestions about this application?

"Manufacturers sometimes ask that retailers not display a price if it drops below a certain amount. The \"Show Price\" message indicates that the price of the item is so low that the manufacturer requested that it not be advertised (that is, displayed). In a brick-and-mortar store, you would probably have to ask a salesperson what the price of the product is.
At Amazon, by selecting \"Show Price\" you are essentially asking to see the price, at which point we show it to you."

When you sign in to the Amazon app, this device will be registered to your Amazon account. You can buy and watch Amazon Instant Video titles on your account.

If you’re not signed in when you tap Your Watchlist, Your Video Library, or try to watch a video, you’ll be asked to sign in.

When you sign out, this device will no longer be registered to your Amazon account and you can’t rent, buy, or watch Amazon Instant Video titles in this app.

To sign out, on the left navigation panel, tap Sign out.

Amazon Prime members get unlimited streaming of more than 40,000 movies and TV episodes.

On the left navigation panel, tap the down arrow next to Amazon Instant Video. Under Prime Instant Video, you can choose TV shows or movies that are available at no additional charge with the Prime membership.

When you find a movie or TV show you want to save for later, add it to Your Watchlist. It’s your custom list of videos chosen by the person who knows you best—you! You’ll find a button to add a video to Your Watchlist on the video’s page, below the purchase and play buttons.

Your Watchlist is shared across all of your devices so you spend less time searching and more time watching.

On the left navigation panel, tap the down arrow next to Amazon Instant Video. Tap Your Watchlist to see videos you’ve added.

To remove a video from Your Watchlist, go to the video’s detail page, and then tap Remove from Watchlist.

Any video you buy or rent on your device, the Amazon website, or many other TVs and devices are added to Your Video Library.

On the left navigation panel, tap the down arrow next to Amazon Instant Video. Tap Your Video Library to start watching your movies and TV shows instantly.

Parental Controls enable you to restrict the viewing of Amazon Instant Video titles. To set the restriction level, go to:

https://www.amazon.com/video/settings

Amazon Instant Video titles are available in Standard Definition (SD) on Android phones. You’ll find most videos have an HD and an SD version. You can toggle between them when you’re on a video’s detail page via a button below the purchase and play buttons.

If you purchase an HD video, you’ll see a notice that the video will play in Standard Definition on your phone. The HD version you purchase will be available in HD on HD compatible devices.

Closed captions let you read the words spoken in a video. Videos with closed captions are indicated by the closed captions symbol. The text is usually in English, but other languages might be available.

To turn on or off closed captions or modify their appearance, while watching a video, tap anywhere on the video to display the video player controls. Tap the Android menu button, and then tap Captions.

To create custom closed captions defaults, go to:

https://www.amazon.com/video/settings

Streaming videos can quickly consume large amounts of data. When you watch videos on a mobile data plan, you can adjust the amount of data used by changing the quality of the video.

On the left navigation panel, tap the down arrow next to Amazon Instant Video. Under More, tap Video Settings. Tap the video quality you want to use.

To restrict video watching only to when your device has a Wi-Fi connection, tap Off.

"Here are some common troubleshooting tips:
• If the video keeps pausing or is low quality, try restarting the video and rebooting your device. You can resume where you left off.
• On some phones, it might take a minute after the video starts for the quality of both the video and the audio to stabilize. • On some phones, it might take a minute after the video starts for the quality of both the video and the audio to stabilize. This can happen each time you jump to a different time in the video.
• If you’re streaming on a mobile cellular network, you might be connected to a slower network. For example, Edge is slower than 3G, and 3G is slower than 4G or LTE.
• If you’re using a public Wi-Fi connection, other computers and devices connected to the same Internet connection can reduce the available bandwidth for video streaming.
• If you’re using a home Wi-Fi connection, stop file transfers and audio/video streaming on other devices on your home network. You can also try restarting your Internet modem or router to ensure you have the best possible connection to your Internet service provider (ISP).
• If there’s no sound with your video, check your device’s volume setting to ensure it’s not turned all the way down. If you’re using headphones, ensure your headphones are snugly connected. If you have a Bluetooth headset turned on, check to see if your audio is being sent there, or try disabling Bluetooth."
"For an overview and help using Amazon Instant Video, please go to: https://www.amazon.com/videohelp"

Eligible products will display a Subscribe & Save Price and a Subscribe & Save: Save X% button below the Buy Now button on the item.

"Select either the Subscribe and Save Price block or the Subscribe & Save: Save X& button below the Buy Now button on the item. Then select the quantity and the frequency in which you'd like to receive this item from the drop-downs. To complete your order click Subscribe Now."

"Credit cards and the Amazon.com Store Card are currently the only forms of payment that can be used for Subscribe & Save orders. Note: We will always apply credit balances already on your account from Amazon.com Gift Cards and eligible promotional codes before charging the remaining balance to your credit card.
You pay for subscription items only as they are shipped. For each shipment, we will charge your credit card for the price of the item at the time the shipment is processed less the Subscribe & Save discount, plus any applicable sales tax."

"To manage your subscriptions (e.g., cancel or skip subscriptions, request an extra delivery) select \"More\" from the Amazon App's Menu, and then select \"Your Subscribe & Save Items.\" If you have multiple addresses, you can select \"Change\" on the top row of the Your Subscribe & Save items page to select the shipping address associated with the subscription you want to view. You'll then be able to view and modify the subscriptions listed under the selected shipping address."

"You can now purchase digital items, such as digital videos, digital music and apps, using the Amazon App.
1–Click ordering is used to purchase digital items. If you click to buy a digital item, it will automatically be charged to the default payment method on your account."

Mobile 1-Click lets you buy items directly instead of adding to the Cart. Turning off Mobile 1-Click does not turn off 1-Click ordering for digital items, such as digital videos, digital music and apps.

The address and payment method you choose will become your default shipping address and payment method for all 1–Click orders on the web or mobile. To add new address or payment method, please visit Amazon.com from your browser.

When Mobile 1–Click is enabled, you will be able to purchase physical items from your mobile device with the click of only one button. You won’t be required to sign in every time you make a purchase. 1–Click ordering is always used to purchase digital items, such as digital videos, digital music and apps If you click to buy a digital item, it will automatically be charged to the default payment method on your account. Turning off Mobile 1–Click does not turn off 1–Click ordering for digital items.

Mobile 1–Click on your mobile device is a separate feature from the 1–Click feature you use on your computer. Each setting may be turned on or off independent of the other. However, your default address and payment methods are the same for Mobile 1–Click, the 1–Click feature you use with your computer, and 1–Click ordering for digital items.

Mobile 1–Click may only be turned on from your mobile device. Your Mobile 1–Click settings are only viewable from your computer if you have Mobile 1–Click activated.

You can turn off Mobile 1–Click from the Your Account feature on either your mobile device or your computer.
